intro: Oreosalsola masenderanica, commonly known as the Masenderanica orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Ecuador, where it thrives in cool, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, pendulous inflorescence and vibrant, colorful flowers that display a range of hues. Its leaves are typically broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
